text: This contained the golden altar of incense, the gold-covered “agreement chest.”9:4. Traditionally translated “ark of the covenant,” a wooden box symbolizing the place of meeting, reconciliation, and agreement between God and his people. Inside this were the golden pot containing manna, Aaron's rod that had produced buds, and the stone inscriptions of the agreement.9:4. Usually believed to be the stone inscriptions of the ten commandments.
